alert.note: Alert for Braxton; Lewis; Randolph; Upshur; Webster (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 05 at 4:46PM EDT until August 05 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR EAST CENTRAL BRAXTON, SOUTHWESTERN RANDOLPH, SOUTHWESTERN UPSHUR, NORTHEASTERN WEBSTER AND SOUTH CENTRAL LEWIS COUNTIES... At 446 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in High water on Rt 15 Gaurdian Drive. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Webster Springs, Addison (Webster Springs), Holly River State Park, Hacker Valley, Cleveland, Eden, Kanawha Head, Diana, Ireland and Alexander. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
